result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on November 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Stanley Correctional)

1:11 PM Defendant DARYL E COWLEY appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the defendant, has not  heard anything from the Public Defender's office. Court will verify with the PD's office the location of the defendant and see where they are in appointing counsel. Court will look at appointing counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:12 PM
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Stanley Correctional - confirmed)

Second appearance on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:07 PM Defendant DARYL E COWLEY appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Short discussion before going on the record, defendant qualifies for a publid defender but has not been appointed one as of yet. Defendant has a release date of January 2, 2027. Court will not yet appoint an attorney on this case. Court sets for Status of Counsel on September 20, 2022 at 1:00 PM

Court adjourned at 1:10 PM
Second appearance on July 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm. (confirmed with DCI)

Statement by defendant - his sister has contacted the Public Defender's office and has not heard anything. Atty Kapelis advises the defendant does qualify but has no other information. Statement by the Court. Court sets for Status of Counsel on July 26, 2022 at 1:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:36 AM

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No Contact with anybody under the age of 16. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

9:41 AM Defendant DARYL E COWLEY in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Statement by defendant regarding bond. Court sets bond at $50,000 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with anybody under the age of 16. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel for June 7, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Defendant has no objection to holding the next hearing by zoom. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. 

Court adjourned at 9:44 AM.
